the hearts bandana is a sweet and simple accessory made using fingering weight yarn and the filet crochet technique to create a breathable mesh fabric with cute heart motifs. filet crochet is a method where designs are formed by alternating open and closed blocks—don’t worry if you’re new to it, because this pattern includes a clear chart, written instructions, and helpful pictures to guide you through each step.

the bandana is worked as one continuous triangle, so there’s no need to cut and reattach yarn throughout—just two ends to weave in when you’re done. it’s lightweight, easy to customize, and beginner-friendly, making it a great project for gifting, markets, or adding a handmade touch to your wardrobe.

even though it uses fingering weight yarn, it works up surprisingly quickly and is a fun, satisfying make. it’s been my go-to accessory for sunny days, keeping my hair in place while adding something handmade and personal to my look.
